member.name: T:mtapi.mt5.IAsyncProxyResult
member.summary: A class that implements the IAsyncResult interface. Objects from this class are returned by the BeginConnect method of the ProxySocket class.

member.name: M:mtapi.mt5.IAsyncProxyResult.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes the internal variables of this object
member.param: An object that contains state information for this request.

member.name: M:mtapi.mt5.IAsyncProxyResult.Reset
member.summary: Initializes the internal variables of this object

member.name: P:mtapi.mt5.IAsyncProxyResult.IsCompleted
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the server has completed processing the call. It is illegal for the server to use any client supplied resources outside of the agreed upon sharing semantics after it sets the IsCompleted property to "true". Thus, it is safe for the client to destroy the resources after IsCompleted property returns "true".
member.value: A boolean that indicates whether the server has completed processing the call.

member.name: P:mtapi.mt5.IAsyncProxyResult.CompletedSynchronously
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether the BeginXXXX call has been completed synchronously. If this is detected in the AsyncCallback delegate, it is probable that the thread that called BeginInvoke is the current thread.
member.value: Returns false.

member.name: P:mtapi.mt5.IAsyncProxyResult.AsyncState
member.summary: Gets an object that was passed as the state parameter of the BeginXXXX method call.
member.value: The object that was passed as the state parameter of the BeginXXXX method call.

member.name: P:mtapi.mt5.IAsyncProxyResult.AsyncWaitHandle
member.summary: The AsyncWaitHandle property returns the WaitHandle that can use to perform a WaitHandle.WaitOne or WaitAny or WaitAll. The object which implements IAsyncResult need not derive from the System.WaitHandle classes directly. The WaitHandle wraps its underlying synchronization primitive and should be signaled after the call is completed. This enables the client to wait for the call to complete instead polling. The Runtime supplies a number of waitable objects that mirror Win32 synchronization primitives e.g. ManualResetEvent, AutoResetEvent and Mutex. WaitHandle supplies methods that support waiting for such synchronization objects to become signaled with "any" or "all" semantics i.e. WaitHandle.WaitOne, WaitAny and WaitAll. Such methods are context aware to avoid deadlocks. The AsyncWaitHandle can be allocated eagerly or on demand. It is the choice of the IAsyncResult implementer.
member.value: The WaitHandle associated with this asynchronous result.

member.name: F:mtapi.mt5.IAsyncProxyResult.m_Completed
member.summary: Used internally to represent the state of the asynchronous request

member.name: F:mtapi.mt5.IAsyncProxyResult.m_StateObject
member.summary: Holds the value of the StateObject property.

member.name: F:mtapi.mt5.IAsyncProxyResult.m_WaitHandle
member.summary: Holds the value of the WaitHandle property.

member.name: T:mtapi.mt5.ProxySocket
member.summary: Implements a Socket class that can connect trough a SOCKS proxy server.
member.remarks:
This class implements SOCKS4[A] and SOCKS5.
It does not, however, implement the BIND commands, so you cannot .

member.summary: Establishes a connection to a remote device.
member.param: An EndPoint that represents the remote device.
member.exception: The remoteEP parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
An operating system error occurs while accessing the Socket.
An error occurred while talking to the proxy server.

member.name: M:mtapi.mt5.ProxySocket.Connect(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Establishes a connection to a remote device.
member.param: The remote host to connect to.
The remote port to connect to.
member.exception: The host parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
An operating system error occurs while accessing the Socket.
An error occurred while talking to the proxy server.
member.remarks: If you use this method with a SOCKS4 server, it will let the server resolve the hostname. Not all SOCKS4 servers support this 'remote DNS' though.

member.summary: Begins an asynchronous request for a connection to a network device.

An object that contains state information for this request.
member.returns: An IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous connection.
member.exception: The remoteEP parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
An operating system error occurs while creating the Socket.

member.returns: An IAsyncResult that references the asynchronous connection.
member.exception: The host parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
An operating system error occurs while creating the Socket.

member.name: M:mtapi.mt5.ProxySocket.EndConnect(System.IAsyncResult)
member.summary: Ends a pending asynchronous connection request.
member.param: Stores state information for this asynchronous operation as well as any user-defined data.
member.exception: The asyncResult parameter is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
The asyncResult parameter was not returned by a call to the BeginConnect method.
An operating system error occurs while accessing the Socket.
EndConnect was previously called for the asynchronous connection.
The proxy server refused the connection.

member.name: T:mtapi.mt5.MD5Managed
member.summary: MD5Managed: A HashAlgorithm implementation that acts as a thin wrapper around a C# translation of the MD5 reference implementation. The C code has been translated as closely as possible so that most of the original structure remains and comparisons between the two are straightforward.
member.remarks:
Derived from the RSA Data Security, Inc. MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm.
Specification: RFC1321 - The MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc1321.html
Original license: Copyright (C) 1991-2, RSA Data Security, Inc. Created 1991. All rights reserved.
License to copy and use this software is granted provided that it is identified as the "RSA Data Security, Inc. MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm" in all material mentioning or referencing this software or this function.
License is also granted to make and use derivative works provided that such works are identified as "derived from the RSA Data Security, Inc. MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm" in all material mentioning or referencing the derived work.
RSA Data Security, Inc. makes no representations concerning either the merchantability of this software or the suitability of this software for any particular purpose. It is provided "as is" without express or implied warranty of any kind.
These notices must be retained in any copies of any part of this documentation and/or software.

member.summary: Finalizes the hash code and returns it.
